model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: Exactly. That's why I felt a written report would be the best way to communicate the information to my boss. It saves time and ensures everything is organized.

[MEMORY]
1. Co-worker A took over their family's business a few years ago and it has improved since then.
2. Co-worker B appreciates the pen and thanks Co-worker A for the gesture.
3. Co-worker A gave Co-worker B a pen as a thoughtful gesture.
4. Co-worker B finished a project and sent it to the manager for review.
5. Co-worker A gave Co-worker B a pen as a symbol of trust in their professional relationship.
6. Co-worker A gave Co-worker B a pen that they still use.
current_dialogue: Co-workers A: Exactly. That's why I felt a written report would be the best way to communicate the information to my boss. It saves time and ensures everything is organized.

None of the MEMORY points provided mention anything about the co-workers' working practices or preferences for communication methods except for the usage of a pen, which is unrelated to the topic of writing reports.
